t: 2 Samuel 22
David’s Song of Thanksgiving
David*p spoke the words of this song to the Lord*s on the day the Lord*s rescued him from the grasp of all his enemies and from the grasp of Saul.
He said: The*pn Lord*s is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer,
my*ln God, my rock where I seek refuge. My*ln shield, the horn of my salvation, my stronghold, my refuge, and*ln my Savior, you save me from violence.
I*ln called to the Lord,*s who is worthy of praise, and*ln I was saved from my enemies.
For*ln the waves of death engulfed me; the*ln torrents of destruction terrified me.
The*ln ropes of Sheol entangled me; the*ln snares of death confronted me.
I*pn called to the Lord*s in my distress; I*ln called to my God. From*ln his temple he heard my voice, and*ln my cry for help reached his ears.
Then*ln the earth shook and quaked; the*ln foundations of the heavens trembled; they*ln shook because he burned with anger.
Smoke*ln rose from his nostrils, and*ln consuming fire came from his mouth; coals*ln were set ablaze by it.
He*ln bent the heavens and came down, total*ln darkness beneath his feet.
He*ln rode on a cherub and flew, soaring*ln on the wings of the wind.

From*ln the radiance of his presence, blazing*ln coals were ignited.

He*ln shot arrows and scattered them; he*ln hurled lightning bolts and routed them.
The*ln depths of the sea became visible, the*ln foundations of the world were exposed at*ln the rebuke of the Lord,*s at*ln the blast of the breath of his nostrils.
He*pn reached down from on high and*ln took hold of me; he*ln pulled me out of deep water.

They*ln confronted me in the day of my calamity, but*ln the Lord*s was my support.

For*ln I have kept the ways of the Lord*s and*ln have not turned from my God to wickedness.
Indeed,*ln I let all his ordinances guide me and*ln have not disregarded his statutes.
I*ln was blameless before him and*ln kept myself from my iniquity.

With*pn the faithful you*ln prove yourself faithful, with*ln the blameless you*ln prove yourself blameless,
with*ln the pure you*ln prove yourself pure, but*ln with the crooked you*ln prove yourself shrewd.
You*ln rescue an oppressed people, but*ln your eyes are set against the proud — you*ln humble them.

With*ln you I can attack a barricade, and*ln with my God I can leap over a wall.
